meanings.definition: A person or group that gives a command or order.
meanings.sent1: The mandators instructed everyone to wear their seat belts at all times.
meanings.sent2: The company's mandators issued a new policy regarding office hours.
meanings.sent3: The mandators decided to make it a rule that all pets must wear tiny hats on Fridays.
meanings.sent4: She was like the mandators of the dance floor, directing everyone's moves effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mandators with megaphones, shouting orders, stuck in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: A person or group that authorizes or directs an action.
meanings.sent1: The mandators approved the budget for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors are the ultimate mandators in this organization.
meanings.sent3: The mandators gave the green light for the construction to begin on Monday.
meanings.sent4: He acted as the mandators of the expedition, guiding the team through treacherous terrain.
meanings.sent5: The mandators' signatures on the document signified official approval of the plan.
